title: Intonation Standard
description:
Intonation Standard is a format component that describes how microtonal intervals are expressed.
As any format component it can be defined as an object with a "type" property that identifies the intonation standard to be used. Check the documentation for that property for details about what intonation standards are supported.

countPerOctave.title: Division Count per Octave
countPerOctave.description: The number of equal divisions of the octave.

type.title: Intonation Standard Type
type.description:
Name that serves as a unique identifier of the Intonation Standard Type. The following values are allowed:
- "cents": scale pitch intervals are expressed as a number value in cents
- "justIntonation": scale pitch intervals are expressed as a string with a ratio of two integers separated by slash, e.g. "5/4"
- "edo": abbreviation EDO stands for equal divisions of the octave; scale pitch intervals are expressed either as a number of divisions or an array with two items, where the first one is the approximate number of 12-EDO semitones and the second one is the deviation from that in divisions.

type.$comment: The Intonation Standard Type can only be set with a string for the types that don't require additional parameters.
